newsitem.title: USA: U S. flag protection amendment approved by panel.
newsitem.headline: U S. flag protection amendment approved by panel.

text.p: A proposed constitutional amendment to protect the American flag from being burned or suffering other forms of desecration was approved by a House subcommittee Thursday.
The amendment would overturn a Supreme Court decision which found that burning the U.S. flag was a form of political protest protected by the Constitution's free speech provisions.

"The American flag represents the very fabric of our nation -- the freedom, democracy and justice upon which our great nation was built," Representative Charles Canady, the chairman of the Constitution subcommittee, said in a statement.
"This amendment gives Congress the power to protect the American flag from physical desecration, giving our national symbol the respect it deserves," Canady, a Florida Republican, added.

The amendment was approved on a voice vote of the 13 subcommittee members and sent to the full Judiciary Committee. Canady said he expected the full House to vote on the amendment by mid-June just before Flag Day June 14.
The amendment was considered in previous sessions of Congress but never got the required two-thirds majority vote needed in both the House and Senate to send it to the states for ratification.
